channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rare-Earth Prices Are in the Doldrums. China Wants to Keep Them That Way.
item.description: China hasn’t been shy about using its dominance of supply chains to apply political pressure.

item.title: ‘It’s a very ugly American trait’: I cried foul when basic-economy passengers grabbed premium-economy seats. The airline has finally shown me respect.
item.description: “That woman and her mother were selfish and self-interested, and believed that they were entitled to get those seats.”

item.title: Stock Dudes Risk a Market Wipeout
item.description: After Thursday’s stock market reversal, the question for investors is whether the megacap trade is over.

item.title: Why small-caps are the ‘most compelling investment case’ right now
item.description: The obvious question for investors is whether the burst of interest in small-caps presages a longer up-trend for the sector.

item.title: Amazon Hits Prime Time for Earnings Expansion
item.description: Advertising and cloud growth have boosted margins and made the stock’s valuation cheaper even as the company’s market cap surges past $2 trillion.

item.title: Are you wealthy, or just rich? Here’s how to tell, according to financial advisers.
item.description: “I know folks who make seven figures a year … but are a couple of missed paychecks away from bankruptcy,” one financial adviser says.

item.title: Social Security Fears Spur These Young Workers to Save More
item.description: The idea of Social Security disappearing is one of the country’s longer-running neuroses and shows few signs of abating. Confidence today is lowest am...

item.title: ‘I want to get control of her money’: My brother left my sister and me $3 million, but she is in hospital with schizophrenia. Will this inheritance be the worst thing for her?
item.description: “At the moment, we are both in Florida, but the inheritance is in a California probate court.”

item.title: Rate Cuts Could Make Things Worse for Banks Before They Help
item.description: With the Federal Reserve poised to begin cutting interest rates, lenders could get caught between falling yields and rising deposit costs, especially ...

item.title: Treasury yields mostly higher as investors assess politics
item.description: Treasury yields mostly rose on Monday as markets shift towards the possibility of a victory for President Donald Trump in November following an appare...
